column2: ITP-240-CIV-Ferris-Under track crossing - Ausnet Gas and Telstra
column8: ITP-240-CIV-Ferris-Under track crossing - Ausnet Gas and Telstra Rev 0

column2: Document Title: ITP-240-CIV-Ferris-Under track crossing - Ausnet Gas and Telstra
ITP Description: Under track crossing - Ausnet Gas and Telstra
ITP approved for use by: Pradeep Talasila
Reference - AS 4799-2000 Installation of underground utility services ad pipelines within railway boundaries
Reference - D/17/62901 Design Requirements & Guidelines - Civil Works on, under or over VicTrack Land
Reference - NIST 012.2 - Specification for Signalling Supply, Construction and Installation (V/Line)
Reference - AS 4142 Fibre Ropes, installed and anchored in the pit
Reference - NIST 012.2.1 - Standard for Construction of Cable Route and Signalling Civil Works (V/Line)
Reference - NIST-2706 - Inspection and Assessment Track Geometry (V/Line)
Reference - VRIOGS 012.2.1. Settlement Monitoring during construction
Reference - VICTRACK STANDARD TS-SP-013 installation of the encasing pipe
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm that the GRP pipes delivered to site meet the Pipe Specifications:
— Joint Type: Stainless Steel Collar with EPDM Seal
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm that the GRP pipes delivered to site meet the Pipe Specifications:
— Joint Type: Stainless Steel Collar with EPDM Seal
Acceptance Criteria - All conduits must have minimum of one 6mm polypropylene draw rope to AS4142.
Acceptance Criteria - Conduit fittings shall be the same type and material as the conduit.
Verifying Documents - This ITP/ Material compliance certificate.
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm that the Gas Encasing pipes delivered to site meet the Pipe Specifications:
Verifying Documents - This ITP/ Material compliance certificate.
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm that the Gas Carrier pipes delivered to site meet the Pipe Specifications:
Verifying Documents - This ITP/ Material compliance certificate.

Acceptance Criteria - Diameter of bored hole to jacking pipe shall not exceed diameter of encasing by more than 50mm. annulus to be grouted with an approve controlled low strength material (CLSM) of minimum 2MPa strength material
Verifying Documents - Material Compliance Certificate and TDS
Reference - IFC Drawings: MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0202 & MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0203, AS4799-2000 cl 3.10
Acceptance Criteria - Be of non-combustible material for the marker plates and of at least fire-resistant material for the pole.
Acceptance Criteria - HDPE welder qualifications to be supplied
Reference - IFC Drawings: MRP-DPK-103-00-CUT-0065, MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0202 & MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0203
Acceptance Criteria - Set out line and level of drilling works.
○ Survey to mark out existing services.
○ Must maintain a min. of 600mm clearance to any existing service and a min. 3m clearance to any Railway Structure UON.
○ GFRP must achieve a min. 1200mm vertical clearance to tracks and minimum 800mm to surface level. Check FSL of track and ground.
Acceptance Criteria - Location as per current Drill shot plans
Acceptance Criteria - Assumed ground conditions are as per site geotechnical report.
○ Geotech Engineer to be immediately notified if the excavations encounter different materials than expected
Acceptance Criteria - Pilot hole to be drilled and fully supported at all times.
Acceptance Criteria - Inclination and path to be monitored as per design alignment.
○ Ensure bore hole blockage and fluid losses are detected and addressed by:
○ Monitoring drilling fluid volumes, monitoring annular pressureand monitoring cutting returns.
Reference - IFC Drawings: MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0202 & MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0203, D/17/62901
Acceptance Criteria - DN427 GRP Jacking Pipe to be reamed, then immediately followed by pipe being pulled through. Bore should remain supported at all times.
○ Diameter of bore is not to exceed diameter of pipe by more than 50mm.
○ Pipes to be installed in straight sections with no excessive bending in the pipes
Acceptance Criteria - Install thininsulators @ 1000mm centres between Encasing pipe and Jacking pipe to ensure centralisation
Acceptance Criteria - Min depth as per IFC drawings.
○ Install thininsulators @ 1000mm centres between Encasing pipe and carrier pipe to ensure centralisation
4.08 - ULX2 - Conduit Installation and Trace Wire
Acceptance Criteria - Min depth as per IFC drawings.
○ All bored communications conduits shall include the installation of stainless steel 3mm trace wire.
Reference - IFC Drawings: MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0002, MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0202 & MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0203

Acceptance Criteria - Both tracks are to be monitored at 2m intervals either side of the centreline of the under bore for 10m either side of the bore centreline, with additional tilt sensors at 5m intervals up to 20m either side of the bore centreline.

○ Settlement to be monitored with the escalation matrix on the monitoring plan to be followed. <5mm = no action. 5 to 9mm = notify v/line for inspection. 10 to 14mm = stop works and rectify. >14mm = halt train operations.
Acceptance Criteria - Joints are to be butt welded.
○ Weld map to be supplied and identify unique joint numbers.
○ Butt Welding records to be supplied.
Verifying Documents - Sign ITP, Butt Welding Records
4.11 - Vent Pipe Installation for ULX1 Gas
Acceptance Criteria - DN50 PE Gas Ven to be installed by Asset owner (Downer) a minimum of 3m away from rail assets

Acceptance Criteria - Diameter of bored hole to jacking pipe shall not exceed diameter of encasing by more than 50mm. annulus to be grouted with an approve controlled low strength material (CLSM) of minimum 2MPa strength material
Acceptance Criteria - The draw rope shall be continuous for the complete length of the conduit run.
○ All draw ropes must be continuous between pits and have 2m slack in the pit.
○ Draw ropes to be restrained in each pit to prevent them from being inadvertently pulled into the conduits
Acceptance Criteria - Plug with 90% of the pipe diameter to be pulled through each conduit to ensure the conduit hasn't been compressed.
Acceptance Criteria - All bored communication conduits shall include the installation of a stainless steel trace wire of 3mm diameter.
Acceptance Criteria - End of encasing pipe to be sealed at each end as per IFC drawings
Verifying Documents - Delivery dockets, Sign ITP

Acceptance Criteria - Entry pits, exit pits and trenches to be backfilled using approved fine crushed rock material. Backfill material shall be compacted to the same density as adjacent material or as specified.
Reference - IFC Drawings: MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0202 & MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0203, AS4799-2000
Acceptance Criteria - Marker posts to be installed at every 200m intervals, any change in direction and at the entry and exit points of VicTrack property.
○ Marker Posts to be placed facing the rail tracks within VicTrack property
○ 50mm x 8mm Galvanised Steel Plate Welded to 50mm Ø Galvanised Post with as Capped top protruding to the air and flatted end in concrete
○ Marker plate riveted to post with 8mm insulated aluminium rivets.
○ Post to be extend 500mm in ground and be concreted in a 300mm Ø footing, concrete to extend out of ground
Verifying Documents - Sign ITP, Delivery Dockets
Acceptance Criteria - Survey as built report to be compiled.
○ Must maintain a min. of 600mm clearance to any existing service and a min. 3m clearance to any Railway Structure UON.
○ Sleeve must achieve a min. 2000mm vertical clearance to tracks.
Reference - IFC Drawings: MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0002, MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0202 & MRP-103-C-AUR-DRG-65-RBK-CUT-0203
Acceptance Criteria - Once works are completed, survey to confirm settlement of the track and ground are within the predicted design settlement values.
○ To be provided to V/Line prior track hand back.
○ Where track has been disturbed beyond the tolerances, realignment and/or maintenance is required by a qualified sub-contractor.
Verifying Documents - Survey As Built Report
Acceptance Criteria - All RFIs, NCRs and changes to the IFC drawings are captured on a controlled drawing set marked "Red-line", "As-built" or similar.
Frequency - Once, after construction of the design package
Verifying Documents - Red Line Drawing Pack

On behalf of Metropolitan Roads Program Alliance, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the item of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
